[[Image:NonFreeImageRemoved.svg|150px|thumb|Steven and Irene Stiles celebrating the election win November 2, 1982]]'''Stephen Stiles''' is a former member of the [[Legislative Assembly of Alberta]].
+
[[Image:Replace this image male.svg|150px|thumb|Steven and Irene Stiles celebrating the election win November 2, 1982]]'''Stephen Stiles''' is a former member of the [[Legislative Assembly of Alberta]].
Stephen first ran for the [[Progressive Conservative Association of Alberta|Progressive Conservatives]] in the February 1982 by-election in [[Olds-Didsbury]] that saw [[Gordon Kesler]] from the [[Western Canada Concept]] elected. He was defeated running a distant third behind [[Alberta Social Credit Party]] candidate [[Lloyd Quantz]].
Stephen first ran for the [[Progressive Conservative Association of Alberta|Progressive Conservatives]] in the February 1982 by-election in [[Olds-Didsbury]] that saw [[Gordon Kesler]] from the [[Western Canada Concept]] elected. He was defeated running a distant third behind [[Alberta Social Credit Party]] candidate [[Lloyd Quantz]].
